resources.string: Lead Android Developer at Bugle Technologies Pvt. Ltd\n Co-organizer at \nGoogle Developers Group Ahmedabad

The task assigned to the participating teams is to design and construct a bridge model, which meets the criteria as given in the rules link. The thinking ability and on the spot decision making ability will be tested by this competition
The bridge model should span a total length of 120.0 cm. The truss and the roadway must be constructed in a single span and brought to the venue.

 All parts of the bridge model must be built with Popsicle sticks (120mm x 12mm x 2mm) and  “Fevicol MR” (No other material is acceptable and team will be disqualified if used).  The roadway (deck slab) must span a total length of 120.0 cm ± 0.5 cm with the centre of the bridge model resting on the support (which will be Provided).  The width of the bridge model must not exceed 15.0 cm at any point and must be more than 10.0 cm at every point.  The total thickness of the roadway/ deck slab (mandatory toconstruct in model) must not be more than 0.3 cm.  A roadway / deck slab is required for all bridge models.  Overlap of two parallel members along their length is not allowed.  Piers must not be constructed.  The total weight of the bridge model must not exceed 0.750 kg.  Coating of paint, adhesive, polish, or any other material must not be applied to exposed surfaces of the bridge model

 Participants have to prepare a TRUSS BRIDGE as per defined criteria.  Initial load applied would be 1.5 Kg. Bridge model should sustain minimum load otherwise it will be disqualified.  The bridge model shall be loaded on both ends of the bridge model (50.0 cm from the centre of the bridge model on both sides)  If for any reason the loading system cannot be placed at the point specified, the loading mechanism will be moved towards the ends of the bridge model until a suitable point is found for loading. .  Measurement shall stop after peak load is reached, or a deflection greater than 3.0 cm is reached at any point.  Winner will be decided by the judges.  Decision of judges will be final and no further debate will be allowed. Some rules and penalties may be mentioned on the spot. Penalty Criteria • If bridge model’s total span is less than defined, the model will be penalized/ disqualified.* • Use of any material other than specified will result in disqualification. • Bridge models with weight greater than specified will be penalized/ disqualified.* • If bridge model’s width is greater or smaller than defined, the model will be penalized/ disqualified.* • Any irregular cross-sections or irregularities in the workmanship, bent bridge models, designs, etc. that do not allow us to test the bridge model on the stated loading mechanism will result in penalty/ disqualification.* • Bridge models with piers will be disqualified. • If coating of paint, adhesive, polish, or any other material is applied to any exposed surface of the bridge model, the model will be disqualified.\n**Penalties will be declared at the time of competition. Penalties will be decided by the judges.

Getting your ideas on paper is the first step towards making it possible and whats better than a confirm chance to get the same printed in a book with an ISBN. It’s often better to grab the opportunity while available than regretting in future. Making a poster is mandatory for this competition and model is optional. Models should be accompanied with the posters.

Making and printing of the banner should be strictly done by abiding the following guideline\n 1. Banner size should be 3ft by 4ft 2. It should be in portrait orientation as shown in figure 3. Banner should contain introduction (history of the subject) 4. It should contain brief description 5. It should contain merits of the project 6. It should contain the references from where you have taken the idea on internet.

Techranga is not just simple rangoli competition. We have added no of obstacles and event competition themes are also innovative each rangoli will be on different idea so that each and every rangoli will present a new message for science, new development, new innovation and future scopes of engineering and our world.

• Each team must only comprise of three students 
 • Time period is 1 hour 30 mins.
 • All other material should be arranged by the participants except colors
 • Winners shall be awarded at the valedictory.
In this event, plan statement will be given on the spot and participants have to draw plan according to it. Knowledge of standards for various plans will be helpful in this event.
⇒ You can register with your team or individually. ⇒ Maximum 2 member in team ⇒ Plan statements will be given there. ⇒ Decision of the jury will be final.
⇒Arrangement of various components of plan. ⇒Standardization and effectiveness of plan.

A programmer is judged on his ability speed and performance under pressure and intense situations. He should be accurate and perfect in his coding abilities. All these skills will be tested in Codepedia.
1st: Blind Code 2nd: Code Hunt 3rd: Code Race

⇒ The tools permitted will be “TURBO C”. ⇒ No external drives are allowed. ⇒ In case of any kind of cheating candidate will be lead to disqualification. ⇒ Decision of judges will be final. ⇒ Incase of conflict between students the coordinators decision will be final

All work and no play makes not only jack but even an engineer to be dull and inactive resource hence gaming skills are also equally important for technical students which keeps their mind active and alert all the time.

⇒ The team should be of 5 members and no changes of players in the team is allowed after they have played their first round. ⇒ No external drives are allowed. ⇒ Decision of judges will be final. • Players must be presented in the tournament area with the whole team at the notifications schedule. Players are advised to be present a few minutes before the schedule to avoid any predictable delay. If the team is not present at the notification schedule they shall be disqualified. • Teams will be given 2 minutes configure their setting and after that use of console or change in setting will be strictly prohibited. • No external drives/devices are allowed. • If the match is involuntary interrupted (Player crash, server crash, etc..)  If are of the player is disconnect or crashed, he must come back in to the game as soon as possible and round will be paused.  If the server crashes before 3 rounds, the whole game shall restart from the beginning else the score will be recorded and the in the new game start money will be set to 5000$.  Compensation will not be given in the money earned in the game and lost due to interruption of the match. • The team should be of 5 members and no changes of players in the team is allowed after they have played their first round. • Decision of judges will be final.

The best ideas come from the best way of searching it and engineers generate the unique ideas due to their ability to search and find whatever they seek however difficult it may be. Can you find what is assigned to you within minutes then this is your arena.

⇒ In this event, you will explore cyber world with GOOGLE. ⇒ No external drives are allowed. ⇒ The Google Hunt consists of clues. ⇒ In each level organizer gives the clues (audio, video, images and information) . The contestants have to find that clues on Google in certain time limit.

This event will test the intelligence rating of the participants. What you see is not actually what you perceive and it’s not necessary that everyone thinks the same hence its important to know the various angles of the same thing which you see.

ROUND 1 ⇒In this round a video clip will be shown to the participants foe 30 seconds. After that few questions will be asked to them related to the video clip shown to them. Top 5 participants will be promoted to the next round. ROUND 2 ⇒In this round a image will be shown to the final 5 participants for 1 minute, after that they will have to write a story on the basis of the image shown to them. Thus at last one winner and one runner up will be declared.
How good are you at finding faults and circuit building? How fast can you assemble a circuit with given limited basic components? Participate and evaluate yourselves.

⇒Here, the organizer gives the different names of circuit to the different groups and they have to draw that circuit on a paper with output. The one who qualifies this level will be promoted to next level.
⇒ An incorrect circuit will be given to the participants where they have to solve it, find it and find the missing components.
⇒ The participants which are qualified in above two levels must have implementation skills. The circuit will be given to them which they have to assembled on the breadboard.

"ELECTRO-HUNT” is based on the knowledge and skills about the electrical components. It includes depth of knowledge about subject, component recognition skills, circuit implementation to judge the potential of the upcoming engineers of future India’s.

⇒ Only team entries are eligible. ⇒ A team shall consist of two persons(ONLY 2 MEMBERS) ⇒ The decision of the quiz-master will be final and will not be subjected to any change. ⇒ The participants shall not be allowed to use mobile or other electronic instruments. ⇒ Audience shall not give any hints or clues to the competitors. ⇒ Replacement of any participant of a team is not allowed after registration.

Interviews prove to be a major barrier in the successful professional life of technical students like engineers, etc because many a time knowledge hidden within is not able to shine up in front due to simple issues like fear of failure and language problem hence it is important for students to face the real life situations to analyze themselves and do proper progress in the required field

⇒ Participant should be in professional attires. ⇒ Participant has to bring their college ID along with them. ⇒ There is no need of any other certificates or documents. ⇒ Participant shall not be allowed to use mobile or other electronic instruments ⇒ Any kind of misbehavior won’t be tolerated. ⇒ Audience shall not give any hints or clues to the competitors ⇒ Replacement of any participant of a team is not allowed after registration.

Only the best can answer the toughest of the questions. Here is your chance to prove that you are the best at what you do and what you have learnt. Quiz is the best way to improve and add to the already powerful theories we have.

⇒ Only team entries are eligible. ⇒ A team shall consist of max two persons. ⇒ The decision of the quiz-master will be final and will not be subjected to any change. ⇒ The participants shall not be allowed to use mobile or other electronic instruments. ⇒ Audience shall not give any hints or clues to the competitors. ⇒ Replacement of any participant of a team is not allowed after registration. ⇒ All the Questions will be related to Electrical Engineering.

⇒ It is an individual Event. ⇒ Each participant will pick randomly 5 chits placed in the bowl in front. ⇒ Themes will be written on them like nature, beauty, etc. ⇒ Participants have to get us the photo based in those themes. ⇒ Photos will be judged on the basis of creativity and innovation. ⇒ Photos will not be judged on the basis of clarity. ⇒ But at least 5 megapixel cameras should be used to click photos. ⇒ Photos should be genuine and should not be copied. ⇒ Photo should be natural not edited. ⇒ Disqualification if photos were found copied or edited

From all corners they come through flame and fear, ping, cutting, hurling maces-the messiahs of destruction, all fighting for the crown. of the robo war winner The carnage will be veiled, the damage catastrophic. let the wars begin.
⇒ Minimum 2 and Maximum 5 Member\n **For More Details Visit Our Site : http://technosonic2k17.com

“More speed, more power with minimum time” Design a manually controlled ROBOT that has capacity to cover maximum distance in shortest possible time, challenging the hurdles and be one of the best opponents. Think your robot can overcome any obstacle-big or small in the least of time. If so get it on the track and let the game begin. And bear in mind that maximizing RPM does not make you winner but winners are those who have good presence of mind, sharpness and practice.
⇒ Minimum 2 and Maximum 4 Member\n **For More Details Visit Our Site : http://technosonic2k17.com
